search_results.query: What do i need to go fly fishing?

snippet.title: An Office Runs Through It: What Fly Fishing Can Teach About Management
snippet.description: In fly fishing and business, what ultimately matters is not just what gets done, it's the way it's done. I often felt I learned less about management from textbooks, and more from flowing water and the behavior of fish. read »

snippet.title: Catskills Fly Fishing Book
snippet.description: Finally, there was a book that covered the fishing on these rivers—the pools, the history, the flies, the techniques—and did so in a comprehensive and very well-written manner. read »

snippet.title: England's Top Fly Fishing Rivers
snippet.description: England's chalk streams are on the top rung of fly-fishing locales. read »

snippet.title: I Killed An Elk. Am I A Murderer?

snippet.description: When Customer Development and the Lean Startup were just a sketch on the napkin, Dino Vendetti, a VC at Bay Partners, was one of the first venture capitalists I shared my ideas with. snippet.title: An Interview With Tom Bie, Founder Of The Drake Magazine
snippet.description: Tom Bie As many of you know, I’m a bit of a flyfishing nut. That obsession started for me at relatively young age, like 10 or 11. Since I couldn’t drive then and had to go to friggin’ school most days, I had no way of fully satiating my intense hunger [...] read »

snippet.title: 12 Ways To Feel Psychologically Better Off Today Than You Did 4 Years Ago
snippet.description: Ronald Reagan (Photo credit: Wikipedia) Countless gurus make a living identifying and interpreting alleged signs of the Apocalypse, but not me. For no fee whatsoever I will address a revelation I had when I heard the recycled Romney/Ryan campaign slogan, “Are you better off today than you were four years ago?” [...] read »

snippet.title: Coincidence? Abe Honors Japan War Dead At Yasukuni Shrine As Okinawa Ok's Marine Air Base
snippet.description: Japan's Prime Minister Shinzo Abe displayed his inbred nationalist zeal when he visited the Yasukuni shrine memorializing Japan's millions of war dead in the face of advance imprecations not to go there. In the storm of denunciations once he had made the trek, word that Okinawa's Governor Nakaima had simultaneously approved construction [...] read »
